column4: can someone help me figure this problem out please? http://paste.ubuntu.com/74620/
is that a real copy paste?
because it says 'settin'
there should just be comments in /etc/X11/xinit/xinput.d/all_ALL I'll show you what mine looks like
http://paste.ubuntu.com/74625/
ill go into fail safe mode and see what i can fix, thanks
/etc/X11/xinit/xinput.d/all_ALL
the file looks the same.
? are you sure?
what happens if you remove /ssh ?
should i remove it from the same file?
well don't remove it, but do you have a /ssh file or folder?
did you add it because by default there shouldn't be one
no i didnt
where'd you get the disc? because that would worry me. But even so could you pastebin .xsession-errors found in your home folder?
i cant find the error file,
try vim ~/.xsession-errors
it might not be there though
honestly I would reinstall, /ssh shouldn't be there unless you put there yourself
can someone get remote access if i didnt set it up for that?
I'm not sure, but if thats there and you didn't create it, there could be other things wrong
